title: Jermain Defoe wants to return to West Ham to right the wrong of leaving them to join Spurs
text:
EFL UNFINISHED BUSINESS Jermain Defoe wants to return to West Ham to right the wrong of leaving them to join Spurs 
Striker's infamous transfer request made him a fans’ hate figure which haunts him to this day Exclusive Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments JERMAIN DEFOE is keen to return to West Ham to ‘right the wrong’ of his infamous transfer request which has made him a fans’ hate figure. 
The naive striker asked to leave the club in 2003 – just 24 hours after The Hammers were relegated to the old Division One. PA:Press Association 3 Jermain Defoe netted twice to earn a point against Liverpool 
It still haunts Defoe, who signed for West Ham at 16, and it is a huge factor behind attempts to get him to go back. 
Keep up to date with ALL the West Ham United news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
A source close to the player said: “Jermain still feels terrible about the whole thing. He was badly advised at the time, when he was just a kid. He accepts that. 
“He loves Sunderland and is doing his best for them and will continue to do so. But there is an emotional attachment to West Ham. 
“If a deal is done and Jermain gets the chance to go back there and score the goals which make sure they stay up and move up the league it would help him heal some old wounds which still hurt him.” Defoe’s goal have been crucial for Sunderland as they fight relegation Related Stories UP THE STAKES West Ham line up second bid for Jermain Defoe and also chase Celtic star Moussa Dembele HERO TO ZERO Sunderland 2 Liverpool 2: Sadio Mane gifts Black Cats late penalty after putting Reds ahead as Jurgen Klopp's men drop points in title race Golden Gray Burnley 4 Sunderland 1: Andre Gray's first Premier League hat-trick pile on misery for Black Cats boss David Moyes Golden Gray Burnley 4 Sunderland 1: Andre Gray's first Premier League hat-trick pile on misery for Black Cats boss David Moyes Jermain man Sam Allardyce wants Jermain Defoe at Palace but Sunderland boss David Moyes will fight to keep him PA:Press Association Striker turned his back on the Hammers as a youngster 
Defoe has been labelled ‘Judas’ by angry Hammers supporters ever since leaving them to join arch-rivals Tottenham.
